website_summaries.verdict: Our pick if you're looking for a pulse oximeter for exercise purposes that's inexpensive and produces readings quickly.
pros: Results are visible in as little as 10 seconds for oxygen saturation, pulse rate, and pulse strength
Large, vivid display that faces users is easy to read
A handy, affordable device for athletes
cons: Occasional inaccurate readings have been noted
Some units quit working after several months of use

customer_reviews.title: Great Pulse Oximeter with extras.
customer_reviews.text: Being a Respiratory Therapist I've used many a pulse oximeter in my career and I was replacing one for my personal use but didn't want to pay a fortune. When I saw the price on this one, I couldn't resist buying it because the price was so low but I was pretty sure it was going to be a big let down. Wow, was I surprised... it works great and even comes with a protective gel case, batteries and even a lanyard. This was a steal for the price, I am very happy and bragging to my friends about this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Coralraven

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Use And Worth The Money
customer_reviews.text: When I first received this product, I immediately opened it to use for the first time. I didn't even need to reference the directions to get it going, and have used it several times since. As a person with Postural Orthostatic Tachycardia Syndrome (POTS) stemming from Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome (EDS), being able to accurately check my heart rate is invaluable. I have multiple medical appointments a week and have been able to test this product against regulated medical equipment - and it has performed perfectly! I've yet to get a reading that is different from what my nurses/doctors have gotten. This product is definitely a good buy at such a low price (less than $15 at the time of posting).
customer_reviews.author: bms05

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pulse oximeter with pulse rhythm as well for verification of information!!! Reliable tool for home use :)
customer_reviews.text: Shows heart rate rhythm... oxygen rate... and heart rate itself as well.. takes 2 AAA batteries included and has a lanyard if you want that on it also... easily fits in a shirt or pants pocket though also! Very useful tool if you are tracking heart rate and/or oxygen levels... the rhythm lets you know it is accurate or what is actually making it to the finger you are clipping this too.. don't think it would work right on other appendages but works well on a finger or thumb here. Would definitely buy again! Easy to read numbers help us track oxygen rate and verify with heart rate in the night too!
customer_reviews.author: Kathi C.

customer_reviews.title: What we were looking for
customer_reviews.text: It has been a life savior. Easy to use and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Josie jacklin

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable 02 assessment
customer_reviews.text: Despite following the product instructions scrupulously, my 02 readings were all over the place and depended heavily on which finger was inserted. If I inserted my little finger, the highest reading I got was 97; if I inserted my index finger, the highest reading was 94. And these were the highest readings in multiple attempts; most reading were lower, including several below 90. At the doctor's office, I have never had a reading below 98. If the readings cannot be trusted, the pulse oximeter is of no use. I returned mine immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied customer

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: I have Copd and needed this to keep track. I was able to compare my readings at my doctors for comparison since i seen some reviews saying it wasn't accurate. Well the doctors and mine came out the same. Im very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: nikki

customer_reviews.title: Not good for medical use
customer_reviews.text: I'm a hospice nurse, had hopes that this would be helpful but it's so inaccurate. Basically if the patient isn't really healthy (which most of mine are not) it doesn't read accurately.
customer_reviews.author: kcat

customer_reviews.title: doesnt work after a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: I bought (3) of these units over the past few months. I'm a heart attack and quad bypass survivor. I bought a pulse oximeter from Walgreens in 2015 and it works flawlessly, but its $49. Figured I'd save a couple bucks so I could make sure I had one of these wherever I was. They all worked great out of the box but after a few weeks the readings were so out of whack (pulse rate 49...then 176 on same reading), a little disconcerting with my heart issues. Spend the extra money a better quality unit.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: 😕Don't
customer_reviews.text: It's called Zacurrate because if they called it Accurate, you could sue for false advertisement. Works for a while (when it wants to). Just spend your money on a better, more trusted brand. Within a month of having it, it started doing really weird things like doing massive jumps on the O2 reading with just a slight touch. Very sensitive but that should not affect the reading 🤔. And it's always nice for your patient to see their pulse is 25 bpm (absolutely inaccurate) and freak out. Like I said in the beginning. Invest in a good, trusted brand to save yourself time and agony. Oh it reads slow too. 😉
customer_reviews.author: Lawanda

customer_reviews.title: Former ICU nurse recommended
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my father who has advanced pulmonary disease due to decades of smoking. He’s now on oxygen most of the time, except for when he’s in denial about needing it. This sensor has helped him realize “Hey, I’m truly not getting enough oxygen. It’s not just all in my RN daughter’s mind.” Don’t smoke. When you’re old, if the planet is still able to sustain human life, you may want to be able to breathe. This works, is accurate and if you have trouble breathing or have a first aid kit where a pulse odometer might be useful, this is a good one.
customer_reviews.author: BahamaMama

customer_reviews.title: useless
customer_reviews.text: On the rare occasion that it actually provides me with a reading, it is so preposterous that I must be dead. Oxygen 43% pulse28?????
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Smith

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and Affordable
customer_reviews.text: Buying the combo pack saved nearly $100. I wanted my own personal equipment for work. This was the most affordable way to do it. The products have proven accurate and easy to use. Never has to look for work equipment again!
customer_reviews.author: Mattie Walker

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate.
customer_reviews.text: I have heart palpatation issues and this comes in handy to monitor my heart rate It's also very useful when I exercise!
customer_reviews.author: Janice Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to use this as an "early warning" in case a mild case of Covid-19 became severe. Unfortunately, it showed me, a healthy middle aged man with no known heart disease or current respiratory issues, as having an SpO2 of 80-91; that's hypoxic. My lips should be bluish! Not only that, but the reading could vary as much as 5-6 points with the device attached and nothing else changing. It's easy to use and read, but if it's this inaccurate, it's useless.
customer_reviews.author: Talbot T. Canham

customer_reviews.title: Great pulse ox
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my SO because one of his colleagues recommended it. They are both medical professionals. It's a great size to put in your pocket or bring in your bag. It's pretty light, and comes with a carrying strap, which is really convenient. The batteries were already included, which was also great. It gives readings quickly and consistently. The readings on the screen also appear very clear and lit well, which is an asset if you need to use this in both light and dark rooms.
customer_reviews.author: cstar

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: It worked okay for about a day then it started to go haywire! It was showing HR of 23 and O2 sat of 50%. It wouldnt work anywhere but a dark room. Not worth it at all
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate reading
customer_reviews.text: I used this on the first day it gave my dad a bad reading. We used this 3 times, then we tried it twice more with a 3-4 min wait before reading to ensure it read it accurately (per nurse instructions because the 1st three readings were very low). We rushed my dad to the hospital because of the low reading and when at the hospital his reading was not at all what this little machine gave us. We even took the machine with us to make sure it was reading accurately. This was a complete waste of my money! I had to buy another one!
customer_reviews.author: widiwidi

customer_reviews.title: Total junk
customer_reviews.text: If you’ve got twenty minutes to reset this thing multiple times, you might get a close to,accurate reading. It consistently tells me that my blood oxygen is 30-50% (I’d be dead by now) and that my pulse is under 50bpm. My Apple Watch and every oximeter I’ve used at the doctor’s office tell a completely different story. Unfortunately I missed the return window so I’m stuck with this piece of junk. If you order one be sure to check that it works as soon as you get it!
customer_reviews.author: Autumn Rowan

customer_reviews.title: Inaccuracy
customer_reviews.text: It’s easy to use and can carry everywhere you go. However I doubt on accuracy because I always get error or wrong reading for older adults. I would invest more money to buy better one for accurate reading.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money! At first I thought what a great took this will be for when I start clinicals however NO. The Pulse Rate is inaccurate as my readings are significantly different after a few minutes of the first reading. I got a new one shipped to me but that didn’t help at all, readings with PR is never consistent.
customer_reviews.author: NurseT

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Wow this this said I had 99 spo2 with a 34 heart rate the on other gunfire 92 spo2 with 112 heart rate. Checke against doctors office and this cheap piece of crud was way off. Don’t trust it, just toss it in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Me Smith

customer_reviews.title: nice product-pulse oximeter
customer_reviews.text: product is easy to use, easy to read. compact design. i have no other to compare its accuracy but i assume its ok. ( i had a one time pulse of 125-not sure why when its usually 60) right hand ( dominant) will give a different reading than left. also-it doesn't usually work if fingers are cold-like after holding a can of pop-have to wait for warmth to return.easy to read big enough digital numbers in red on black background. uses aa batteries instead of those itty bitty watch batteries, i would recommend/buy it again
customer_reviews.author: cairn terrier lover

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for measuring blood O2 levels
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive, but works perfectly. Nice and handy to have for someone who has low O2 problems. Can easily check them when they're on and off oxygen.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not super accurate.
customer_reviews.text: Consistently tells me my oxygen is 96% then after 20 sec goes to 99%. I'm always at 99% when using an accurate tool. My 4 yr old has tried it and it does the same for her. My 2 yr old's hands are too small to make it work. If you need this for a medical condition and it's super important, then spend the extra money on a better tool. I just wanted this due to the pandemic and thought it may come in handy one day. Otherwise I'd return it.
customer_reviews.author: Justthe2ofus

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, but not as accurate in sat %
customer_reviews.text: I am a respiratory therapist and am on postop leave. I needed a pulse ox monitor while on my pain medicine with some other side effect symptom. This is not as accurate as the high dollar ones but it gets it in the estimated ball park. The numbers bounce up and down a lot which is accurate in the sense that it is measuring light (bloodflow) but shouldnt range as much as it does. However it's best to KEEP IN MIND, all pulse ox monitors only "measures" and do not give true saturation numbers so for the price, it gets the job done. Appreciate how light weight it is.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Gives inaccurate readings!
customer_reviews.text: It gives inaccurate readings. Within a 30 second time frame the spO2 reading slowly fluctuated between 91-98! I compared this with a Choicemmed pulse oximeter at the same time which held steady at 98 the whole time. "Zacurate" must be using inferior parts. I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Consistently low readings
customer_reviews.text: After comparing the readings between this and the proper medical equipment at my doctor's office a couple of times now, we find that this unit consistently reads 4 or 5% low. It's good enough to keep track of trends, but in my (and my doctor's) opinion, shouldn't be trusted for accurate and actual oxygen level readings. On the plus side, it's foolproof to use and very easy to read. Those points, though, still don't quite outweigh the fact that it doesn't perform its primary function well enough for my taste.
customer_reviews.author: Rick H.

customer_reviews.title: Finally one that is accurate !
customer_reviews.text: Checked this oximeter against a friend (Medivac } and .....right on !..........checked it 3 time's .......same result ......read the instructions and you won't have any trouble .........paid 3 time amount for others at drug store (Disappointed) Finally got it right ! Mike
customer_reviews.author: Mike W

customer_reviews.title: Great pulse ox!
customer_reviews.text: This arrived in a nice package and was very easy to install the 2 AAA batteries that were included the box. It comes with a lanyard if you want to put in on the pulse ox but that is just a personal touch that some may like. It works great and it accurate. I would definitely recommend this pulse ox to others.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for when I'm Rounding on My Patients
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate pulse Ox (as compared with hospital grade equipment) that is cheap and easy to carry around in white coat pocket or around neck. As a resident, It's great for double checking O2 sats when I'm rounding on my patients prior to presenting to my attending. Battery has lasted a long time (~6 months) so far and it's auto turn off feature works well. Would def recommend to other health care providers and purchase again if needed!
customer_reviews.author: Rhushi

customer_reviews.title: Great and accurate especially for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I work for the schools as a nurse and this little guy is so handy. I watch a child on a ventilator on the bus and at school this is small enough to put in my purse. He has a fancy Smart Monitor which also comes with him and the numbers match each other within a couple digits. It seems very accurate. It picks up the heart rate and SpO2 on his cold small fingers which impresses me for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: A good little product, overall.
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be accurate. I am rating it as a four star due to the fact that I must wait a couple of minutes before a true reading will appear. And I have to jiggle it, remove it for couple of seconds, or place it on a different finger. Then I will get a true reading and it will remain very accurate - I have been testing it against a rather expensive one the visiting nurse brings with her. Perhaps it just needs to warm up?
customer_reviews.author: Cerulean Artist

customer_reviews.title: True Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for one of my children because of disabilities. It seems to be very accurate and I use it daily to get readings from my child. Thank you for the product because it keeps my girlfriend and I at ease. We wouldn't know his oxygen levels only to rush him to the hospital because of breathing problems and find out he was below 80% oxygen. That happened twice and not anymore because any slight steady decline we take him there before it gets bad. Would not be able to tell if we didn't buy this. This was our first purchase of a Pulse Oximeter and it does work perfectly so far. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: DaveZ

customer_reviews.title: Takes accurate readings
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when diagnosed with a lung disease and informed needed to use oxygen. I took to the pulmonologist office and only off by one number compared to theirs. Use it to track my oxygen levels and record in a journal. Easy to use, recommended to use on left index finger. Replace with batteries is easy. Just slide back cover off.
customer_reviews.author: Pumpkin48

customer_reviews.title: Just a toy!
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't really help. At times it gives random numbers for heart rate. Lets put it this way, if the heart rate on this thing says your heart is beating over 150 beats pur minute, it's probably giving you bad information. Even the manual say that it's just a novelty.
customer_reviews.author: Robert VR

customer_reviews.title: Must have during this Pandemic
customer_reviews.text: This little device is a must-have doing this pandemic! I contracted with COVID-19 and ended up in ICU but upon returning home To quarantine and finish recoveringI had to check my oxygen levels. I didn’t realize how much the oxygen level play a part with COVID-19. It is very important that you check your level two or three times a day. Very Very important!
customer_reviews.author: PATRICIA

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and Accurate.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for over a year. Handy battery charge indicator; keep fresh batteries in device for optimum accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick L. Mccartney

customer_reviews.title: Totally Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: I have pnumonia and bought this to track my recovery. This thing reads 5% below the calibrated unit at the hospital and is totally worthless. I went to the Dr. with this thing thinking I was hypoxic. Luckily Amazon issued a refund without having to return it.
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: Blood oxy % When YOU want.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the immediacy of blood oxy reading, the ease of use, portability, and quality of the product. Instead of waiting every 6mos at my check up I can get my reading anytime, 24/7/365-1/4! Convenience!!! Great product, as was promised!
customer_reviews.author: Mario C. Elia

customer_reviews.title: Each finger is a different reading, same finger consecutive testing also give different reading
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if it's normal because of how human bodies work, but I've been using this with my parents daily, and the same issue happens with all of us. Each finger gives a different reading, ranging from 92 to 99. Even on the same finger, if we wait for the device to power down first and then test again, it'd be a different result. So far we haven't seen consistently low reading so we haven't panicked, but given the +/-2 range, it was unnerving to see 92 a couple of times.
customer_reviews.author: xxclare

customer_reviews.title: not reliable!!!!
customer_reviews.text: oximeter readings are unrealistic as they bounce up and down during the same usage....totally disappointed.......at first I thought it was the batteries, but replacement of new batteries produced the same results
customer_reviews.author: sandy l.

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: Sad to say that this product is little more than a toy. I took this device with me on a visit to my doctor. Just before the nurse took an oxygen reading I got a reading of 84. A minute later the doctor's readout was 95! I took a reading yesterday and my oxygen level read 88. Right afterwards I took it again and it read 92. When I change fingers and take it again it shows different levels per finger. My health depends on an accurate oxygen reading. This product will not deliver that so I need to find one that will.
customer_reviews.author: Jim A

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, sturdy, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with this product. Needed a finger pulse oximeter for a spare kit for side gigs. The product arrived before the scheduled delivery date, solid packaging, clear instructions and user manual, 2 AAA batteries included. It's sturdy, simple to use, highly precise, easy to read in well lit area and dark area. Good size, light, portable, low battery consumption. Recommended for children 2yrs - Adults. I remove batteries after each job. Wipe clean. Highly recommend. Would purchase again. Good value, very good price #happycustomer
customer_reviews.author: VMusing777

customer_reviews.title: Takes multiple attempts to get a correct reading
customer_reviews.text: The Pros: Very compact so can fit in a pocket, purse, or drawer. Easy to read with bright, large digital read-out. Batteries included so you can get it up and running right out of the box! The Cons: Many times it takes multiple attempts to get an accurate reading. For instance the first couple readings may show a pulse of 25 or something obviously wrong. A third or fourth attempt will show a pulse in the 60s/70s which is correct. SO, in light of that, it's a 3 star or lower rating. You will get an accurate reading only after a few attempts. Not great, but does work.
customer_reviews.author: katfish

customer_reviews.title: Does't work
customer_reviews.text: My husband has used this type of monitors for several years. The one he had was getting old so we decided to get a new one. He picked on this one because it was like the one he had. The first one didn't work right so the company sent us a new one. However this one doesn't work right either and now it isn't returnable. So I guess we are stuck with it. I have bought one from Target.
customer_reviews.author: Quilter

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to read: yes. Easy to operate: yes. Neither of these matter as the readings are so inaccurate.
customer_reviews.author: Becki Foster

customer_reviews.title: Went haywire after a few times
customer_reviews.text: This fingertip pulse oximeter is easy to use but unfortunately mine stopped working after the first few uses. Either that, or my oxygen is 24 and my pulse is 30. The first few times i used it, it seemed fairly accurate even tho i did not have another one to compare results. Then it started giving obviously inaccurate readings. After it acted up, it stopped giving any readings at all. And the battery monitor shows the batteries are fully charged.
customer_reviews.author: foxyrich

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't give accurate readings
customer_reviews.text: The Oxygen level is all over the place, never the same thing twice. Gave me several readings of 88 or less. If my Oxygen was really that low, I wouldn't be able to do much of anything. So this just doesn't do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't purchase
customer_reviews.text: I am a RN and although this is an easy piece of equipment to use, it is inaccurate.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Rowda

customer_reviews.title: Pulse Oxygen Meter provide Peace Of Mind!
customer_reviews.text: Our 9yr old ended up with a bad cold that w/in days went into a scary lung infection that landed us in hospital for 2 days. As soon as the Dr started to talk about discharging ya we knew we needed that extra Peace Of Mind. Especially at night. Well not only was the Zacurate Pulse Oxygen Meter waiting, at our door, that day (Dec 23rd) it even arrived w/batteries, and used it within minutes of arriving home as well as throughout the first night while our child peaceful slept. As easy to use, and as valuable, as a thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: Lelah  Beckerle

customer_reviews.title: Far more than I expected for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This oximeter works consistently. I did notice there is a 3 percent difference between this and other pulse oximeters at the hospital and doctor. For instance a 96 percent on this oximeter mean it is really 99 percent. Since the difference is consistent I don't see it as that big of a deal for the price I paid for it. It has been a godsend for monitoring my oxygen for severe asthma.
customer_reviews.author: W.S.

customer_reviews.title: Extremely poor design
customer_reviews.text: Fingernail must be extremely short and pushed all the way in to the end. Must sit very still during reading. Accuracy is only thought to be accurate if 30% of the moving bars are showing. Others do not require these things. Keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: I like this little gizmo
customer_reviews.text: I like this little gizmo. I am on oxygen 24 hours a day. It gives me peace of mind knowing what my levels are and not having to wait for a doctors visit or going to the fire station and letting them do it. It’s accurate and small enough to carry it around with you where ever you go. It was a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Carla

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and read
customer_reviews.text: Not sure of its accuracy, nothing to compare it to. My dad is 85 and just released from the hospital with orders to monitor his heart rate. It’s easy to use reading heart and oxygen. This model was recommended by a physical therapist upon his release.
customer_reviews.author: Helen  Margurite

customer_reviews.title: Ahhhhh, just not sure!
customer_reviews.text: I felt like we needed to get this with all that is going on to replace the one we broke several years ago. I do find that this is a little off with the reading. The kids readings are always where they should be but for bigger fingers it has a harder time. My husbands is always different but only by a couple numbers and mine does the same. Maybe we got a faulty one or maybe that’s how this one is.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger Pritchett

customer_reviews.title: Easy & Accurate!
customer_reviews.text: I got this in order to see how/if my pulse or oxygen saturation was being compromised by wearing a mask. We didn't bother reading anything before putting it on b/c it always seemed so straightforward when they used it at the doctor's office. Basically all you need to know to use it is, ([(Put the batteries in that come with it! This doesn't seem like something that needs to be said, but there's always that one person...)]), press the power button on top, wait for it to zero out, and THEN put your finger in. Takes all of maybe 2-3 seconds to be ready to go. Easy peasy! Works great & seems to be accurate so far!
customer_reviews.author: sgtamos

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after two months
customer_reviews.text: The oximeter seemed to work well at first. However, I set it aside for a couple of weeks it ceased to function effectively. Sometimes it would not give me a reading. Sometimes it gave me low and variable oxigen and pulse readings. There is no I that my pulse can be 24 per minute!
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy...
customer_reviews.text: Gives low readings especially on darker skinned patients/people. Even changed batteries a couple of times to make sure that wasn’t the problem but it didn’t change the low reading. I compared with another pulse oximeter for comparison and verified that the Zacurate does not give reliable readings.
customer_reviews.author: lucila

customer_reviews.title: The worst pulse Oximeter I Have Used
customer_reviews.text: Just after close of the return window, the PO started abruptly turning off. It was unusable after 3 months. The reading is extremely erratic with all the 3 members of the household, of different age groups (10 years to 40 years), showing a reading of 96-97 mostly. I have used more than 5 PO in my life time, mostly for my ailing parent. This is a pure junk.
customer_reviews.author: drb

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have
customer_reviews.text: I like this one because it is easily read from the wearer's viewpoint, (some are upside down as they are made for the caregiver's viewpoint). The user manual booklet desribes this device as being "intended for non-medical use by healthy people to monitor their pulse rate and oxygen" "people who need SpO2 and PR should not use this device" page 12 of the user manual. It is not accurate if used while in motion and gives different results depending upon the finger/toe being used. I don't know why, just an observation while I am learning the uses. The heartbeat is easily compared to other devices and seems accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Raina

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, turn it on before
customer_reviews.text: I am a senior and like to keep track of my breathing efficiency. I know this is not as accurate as one made specifically for medical use, but it appears to be accurate enough for my purposes. I did find I get a better reading if I turn it on and let the screen adjust to the blank position before I insert my finger. I wait about 5-8 seconds for my reading. After that the reading will degrade.
customer_reviews.author: Harborlou

customer_reviews.title: Accurate Reading
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Unfortunately I had the need to check the accuracy when a relative had a heart emergency. I took it with me to the hospital and compared the readings to the monitor in the room. It was identical up or down the same reading. Surprising for such an inexpensive product. Will buy a second one shortly.
customer_reviews.author: AGLEZ

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: Even though it was used exactly as recommended, the oxygen saturation level reading was often inaccurate (which can send one into a panic when monitoring the symptoms of a chronic pulmonary disease). Tried changing the batteries, the nurse at the hospital attempted to recalibrate it... we still couldn't get a correct reading.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Accurate with direct comparison to professional devices
customer_reviews.text: I’m a registered nurse who works in the respiratory facility and purchased this because I was beginning to have trouble with my asthma. Because some of my readings were very low I was concerned about the possible accuracy of this device however when compared with the professional clinical pulse oximeter‘s in the hospital several different types of probes all of them consistently show this to be a very accurate and effective tool.
customer_reviews.author: Woundrn

customer_reviews.title: ... that I received the Oximeter and it arrived in perfect condition and on time
customer_reviews.text: Just wanted you to know that I received the Oximeter and it arrived in perfect condition and on time. I have used it and it works great as I knew it would,also it's so easy to use. I tested it for myself with the info from my last doctor's visit and I can say for me it was accurate,and on point. I really like it.Many Thanks. Sincerely,R McCabe
customer_reviews.author: Robin McCabe

customer_reviews.title: Basic model provides the most needed information for my job as a hospice nurse.
customer_reviews.text: The zacurate 500 BL seems to be functioning as stated. No problems encountered. Purchased to have as a backup, but may switch to this one as primary and another store-brand model as my back-up pulse oximeter. Good value for price. The cost of more expensive models doesn't change the basic information of heart rate and saturation, and the added features on more expensive models are not needed for use in my job. Thanks for providing an option that keeps things simple!
customer_reviews.author: #DobieLife

customer_reviews.title: Quick check on your blood oxygenation
customer_reviews.text: I've had congestion problems in the past, and with the coronavirus concerns these days, I wanted a quick check on my blood oxygen. The device comes with a warning that it shouldn't be relied on for medical reasons, and I agree with that. But having a quick check after exercise, or before, is a good hint if there might be a problem. The device is easy to use and easy to read. But because it does respond quickly in measuring, and is dependent on no light obstruction of the nail (nail polish can interfere with the process), the reading may not be absolute, only indicative. Still, it's a good thing to have at hand.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Beach

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: I found my purchase to be of excellent quality and an extremely good value when compared to other products in the same category. The Oximeter worked perfectly right out of the box. Remember to pull the battery tape out before use. I checked the results against a much more expensive meter and the readout was exactly the same. The numbers are large and bright red. Very easy to see even in low light. I appreciate the included silicone cover and strap. I would not hesitate to purchase or recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jody

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good - I've used this oximeter for some weeks now, and it's both matched my cuff for accuracy (in terms of pulse) and provided quick, easy results. I'm quite happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: I purchase two of these for the pandemic. Both were way inaccurate. I tried both of them and they both read an O2 level of from 90 to 94. So, I went to my local retailer, bought two more for $32 each, tried them, and both read an 02 level of 98 to 99. So, I would not recommend these
customer_reviews.author: J.R.

customer_reviews.title: Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly as it describes and does so accurately. Just as good as the one at the doctor's office! However, new smartphones all have the ability to do exactly what this does, so it sadly just sits in my medicine cabinet unused now.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Eases my mind
customer_reviews.text: I use this daily. I am a poor judge of my own health. Sometimes my chest feels tight, but this instrument assures me that I am getting enough oxygen. Other times, I don't feel that much worse, but the reading suggests I might need to step up to the next medication. I have used it right outside the doctor's office and find it is the same result from the doctor's, which is reassuring. Warning: The pulse and O2% are reversed in the doctor's equipment, so I had some shocks until I learned that. This is actually the 2nd one I have bought. (I recently found the first one lost in the recliner.)
customer_reviews.author: KBH

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I don't always notice when I'm having an attack because it's less suddenly-can't-breathe and more a slow strangling of my lungs. I was on a trip recently and had a very bad reaction to the pollen there. It took me three days of struggling before I realized what was wrong. I know, what a dummy! But an oximeter would have helped so I got this one. It's perfect, exactly what I wanted, and it helps me monitor my heartrate for other conditions I have. :)
customer_reviews.author: buhfly

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate oxygen readings.
customer_reviews.text: I had a good experience with a similar device in the past, and had hopes for this based on reviews. I have an antitrypsin deficiency with impaired oxygenation capacity. I was alarmed to get low readings and then realized they were internally inconsistent with each other. Example: 77 followed several minutes later by 85 and so on. I crossed checked this against readings from hospital based equipment (considerably more costly) and found that my ratings were in the usual low 90 range. I would suggest that users approach this device with considerable caution.
customer_reviews.author: arthur soule

customer_reviews.title: NOT ACCURATE
customer_reviews.text: This kept reading my oxygen at concerningly low so O took to my doctor appointment with me. My doctors machine said 98% but this says 92% oxygen saturation. (Pulse was correct.) Not accurate!
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Easley

customer_reviews.title: Pulse rate reading was unreliable
customer_reviews.text: The Zacurate 500BL Fingertip Pulse Oximeter Blood Oxygen Saturation Monitor appears to be nicely made. It's easy to operate, the display is easily readable, and the price was great, but I returned it. About half of the time, the monitor would deliver an erroneous reading, showing the pulse rate was twice what it actually was. I will be reordering a more expensive model, and hoping for better results.
customer_reviews.author: ModelAJ

customer_reviews.title: Junk.
customer_reviews.text: Used it less than two dozen times and it broke. Unfortunately I'm out of the return window. Gives a constant "03" for blood oxygen level and "204" for heart rate. I must be dead as I'm writing this. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Hilton

customer_reviews.title: Good, but may want to upgrade to the better ones.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. My only issue is the accuracy. Seems to typically be a little bit less accurate than the ones at my hospital. It also takes a good minute if not more to get a good reading. Comes in handy when all the other pulse ox are in use at the hospital. But I would recommend spending a few more dollars for the better ones.

customer_reviews.title: Highly inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: Drastically inaccurate. Were I to actually try to rely on this for blood saturation readings every person checked would need to be on an ambulance to the emergency room.
customer_reviews.author: Roosterq

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this smart little device that takes no effort to set up and use, well, almost...
customer_reviews.text: 5000BL Finger Pulse Oximeter device works just as smartly as the one in the doctor's office. With the current Covid situation, thought having one on hand might be helpful if anyone was to get the virus and need to recover at home--monitoring blood oxygen levels is critical. Easy to unpack, load the batteries and give it a trial run. Works exactly as advertised and would highly recommend...now if I could only figure out how to get the lanyard threaded through the ridiculously tiny and hard to access holes. All suggestions found in other reviews were not helpful.
customer_reviews.author: BA

customer_reviews.title: I think it works.
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't tell if this was really reading right or not. It seems to have trouble displaying my heartbeat (the pulsing LEDs up the side)... but it seems to read the right numbers otherwise. I try different fingers, and positions. Just seems to not be very fast to react with the moving leds. Took it with me to the doc, to compare its reading to a 'professional model' he uses... and they seemed on par. So I'm taking that as "the readings are good, but the animated pulse thing is junk".
customer_reviews.author: IncredibleHat

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: This is the first pulse oximeter that I've purchased so I can't compare it to others. The only issue I had with this oximeter (which might be a problem with all of them), is that it couldn't take an accurate reading if the hand/fingers were cold. I was using this for my grandmother and she had poor circulation and her hands and fingers would be cold. It worked fine on me. Other than that, it was easy to set up and use.
customer_reviews.author: J.A.M.

customer_reviews.title: Never easy to use and stopped working after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: This device worked for about 3 months, and even then it was difficult to position your finger to get an accurate reading. (I worked in a clinic for 8 years so I know how this should work). When it started becoming more erratic, we assumed it needed batteries we did not have (AAA) - not impossible to find but not used in any other appliances. New batteries made no difference - device gives us random patterns as if it’s trying to communicate in an alien language. Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.author: Joan E. Obrien

customer_reviews.title: COVID-19 NECESSITY IN US HOUSEHOLDS
customer_reviews.text: I was recommended by my family physician to monitor the oxygen level in my entire family. Why? My wife is a severe diabetic, I am awaiting a liver transplant and my only child, 28, is a high function autistic savant with an immuno-compromised system. Each of us needs to know our daily pulse and oxygen to be the earliest reading to possible illness, or god forbid, Covid-19. We live a sheltering existence as many Americans do in this age. This fine product provides us that daily information. Murphyworks
customer_reviews.author: Murphyworks

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and seems to work
customer_reviews.text: This inexpensive pulse oximeter seems to work like the ones I've seen at the doctor's office, although it is not marketed as a medical quality device. It is not possible for me to say whether or not the readings are accurate, but at least I can say that the readings seem plausible. I did note that my SpO2 reading seems consistently two to three points higher in my right pinkie versus my right index finger. I have no idea whether other pulse oximeters might show this same disparity.
customer_reviews.author: MrTechieGuy

customer_reviews.title: Exactly like the one in my Dr.'s office.
customer_reviews.text: Having COPD, this has come in handy many times. Helped me find my weak times and what causes breathing issues for me. Now I no longer have to wonder!
customer_reviews.author: K. Norfolk

customer_reviews.title: Small, and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been having shortness of breath since January (NOT covid related!) and for months I’ve been battling with doctors to try to figure what it is. I bought this recently to keep track of my oxygen levels which are pretty normal! I was just diagnosed with Celiac not too long ago and believe it’s digestion related (whereas my doctor thinks it’s not). It’s nice to have and keep track of, especially when I’m having a bad attack. Accurate and easy to read!
customer_reviews.author: corpusbonds

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Seems every time I purchase electronics from Amazon they seem not to work properly. Numbers record very low and have used on many persons with the same results. Threw in the trash . Will not purchase again. If there was a zero I would put zero .
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Useful, affordable, not very accurate
customer_reviews.text: Very affordable. Readings of pulse and oxygen are usually lower than other pulse ox's. I have compared between several and this one is always on the lower end. Takes a couple to several minutes to get a more accurate reading, but still lower numbers.
customer_reviews.author: Deb W

customer_reviews.title: Useless - Detects pulse in a pen
customer_reviews.text: This unit is useless. When I insert a ball pen, it detects 93% oxygenation and 40 pulse in it also! I just don't know how it raked up that many positive reviews. I am returning the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Outerspace

customer_reviews.title: Always pays to be prepared!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really convenient tool to have on you, I got to lend it to a respiratory therapist at my first day of clinical in nursing school and I felt very accomplished! It also works very well and has a good battery life!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly S Jagger

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: Power button doesn't work so I have to pull the battery out and put it back in to turn it on. Although my O2 rate is correct (presumably) the heart rate has me dead, or on the brink of death. Came with dead batteries and by the time I got those replaced, I missed the return window. Very disappointed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bell

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly! Best price available.
customer_reviews.text: Works just as well as the $30-40 models! I’m a nurse who performs home visits and encourage my patients with COPD and sometimes CHF to purchase a pulse oximeter so that pulse and o2 sat can be monitored at home. This is the most inexpensive model I’ve found and I recommend this model to everyone. I’ve bought between 10-15 for some of my company’s nurses and for pt’s with no internet access... these are affordable for everyone! And yes, we’ve compared this model to some of the more expensive models that our nurses have and they’re exactly the same. Just make sure finger is inserted all the way in and take off nail polish for a better reading.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Worked ok for 2 days
customer_reviews.text: I liked it for 2 days and then it quit working. Took out the batteries and it worked for a little while longer. I totally replaced those batteries with brand new ones and it worked again for a few hours. I need something I can count on and it is not this.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Good enough.
customer_reviews.text: For the price one should not expect an instrument with medical accuracy, and this is not that accurate. But it is close - I compared it to measurements taken at my last doctor's visit. And close is good enough to know if you are in the safe range for O2 or need to be concerned. Same with pulse monitoring.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick F.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, good price.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work. But pulse rate is higher than i know mine us. It’s more at 70-72. I will have to check with my doc. But works very fast. Tried on both hands and several times. Seems to show consistent number. Tried with pen and it doesn’t show any numbers at all. That’s what i want to happen. For note it looks good for the price. Also batteries were included. Which was a huge help. All in all i like it and would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Singri

customer_reviews.title: Works great and so handy!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased to use while my mother was in ICU. So annoying to have to disturb the staff every time the alarm went off and the oxygen saturation needed checking. I used this handy item which I verified worked perfect by measuring simultaneously with the hospital oximeter the staff was using. A good anxiety reliever in these situations. Well priced. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Milacaona

customer_reviews.title: quick easy to read readings
customer_reviews.text: overall, this is easy to use. Just put it on your finger and turn it on. Usually it measures results quickly. But sometimes it will take a few seconds to get an accurate reading. If the number is different than what you expect or is jumping, just wait a few more seconds for it to stabilize and give you a stable number. In my case, the number usually is around the 96-97 mark. And this device consistently hits those numbers.
customer_reviews.author: SoCal Hiker and ProspectorTop Contributor: Hiking

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Nice simple to read. Just not sure about how accurate it actually is. But close enough for what I need. Happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn Y Walker

customer_reviews.title: Simple & useful, great for alpine climbing or just general health
customer_reviews.text: Bought this originally for climbing, but have been using it more for health tracking. Was awesome on one mountain when my buddy wasn't feeling great but wanted to continue. We had taken a reading earlier and when we took another we could see that it was time to turn around and get him to a lower elevation. Read online that it's not the most accurate (by a couple percentage points maybe), which is why you want to take readings regularly so you know what your normal is
customer_reviews.author: Mike

product_meta.title: Zacurate 500BL Fingertip Pulse Oximeter Blood Oxygen Saturation Monitor with Batteries and Lanyard Included (Navy Blue)
product_meta.description:
Color:Light Navy Blue

The Zacurate Fingertip Pulse Oximeter is manufactured according to the CE and FDA standards set for pulse oximeters designed for pilots or any sport enthusiasts who want to obtain their SpO2 (Blood Oxygen Saturation Levels) and PR (Pulse Rate) on the go, the pulse oximeter LED display faces the user so that the user can read it easily.

Taking a reading is easy, just clip it on to your finger and turn it on at the press of a button. The large LED display makes viewing the results a snap. Its small size makes it easy to carry around and a lanyard is also included for added convenience. Comes with 2 AAA batteries so that you can use it immediately upon arrival.

This device is for Sports & Aviation use only and is not a medical device.

Comes with 1 year manufacturer warranty. Terms and conditions apply. Please refer to the manufacturer website for more info.
feature_bullets: ACCURATE AND RELIABLE - Accurately determine your SpO2 (blood oxygen saturation levels), pulse rate and pulse strength in 10 seconds and display it conveniently on a large digital LED display.

SPORT/HEALTH ENTHUSIASTS - For sports enthusiasts like mountain climbers, skiers, bikers or anyone interested in measuring their SpO2 and pulse rate. SpO2 and Pulse Rate now faces instead of away from the user for easy read.
EASY TO USE - Taking a reading is easy, just clip it on to your finger and turn it on at the press of a button.
ACCOMODATES WIDE RANGE OF FINGER SIZES - Finger chamber with SMART Spring System. Works for ages 12 and above.

LOADED WITH ACCESSORIES - Include 2X AAA BATTERIES that will allow you to use the pulse oximeter right out of the box and a LANYARD for convenience. Comes with 12 months WARRANTY and USA based technical phone support.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
